children: From Wikipedia “A Christian mission is an organized effort for the propagation of the Christian faith. Missions involve sending individuals and groups across boundaries, most commonly geographical boundaries, to carry on evangelism or other activities, such as educational or hospital work.”

This “mission” could also act as a metaphor for the job of the previous tracks protagonist, the runner. The runner sticks to his “mission” delivering drugs, keeping the operation “on track” while staying out of harms way (“I flinched at the switchblade switching” & “I did good, I stayed out of the kitchen”). In this case, the “chief” mentioned is his drug dealer boss.
